an8.1:1.2: At one time the Buddha was staying near Sāvatthī in Jeta’s Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s monastery.
an8.1:1.3: There the Buddha addressed the mendicants,
an8.1:2.1: “Mendicants, you can expect eight benefits when the heart’s release by love has been cultivated, developed, and practiced, made a vehicle and a basis, kept up, consolidated, and properly implemented.
an8.1:2.3: You sleep at ease. You wake happily. You don’t have bad dreams. Humans love you. Non-humans love you. Deities protect you. You can’t be harmed by fire, poison, or blade. If you don’t reach any higher, you’ll be reborn in a Brahmā realm.
an8.1:2.4: You can expect these eight benefits when the heart’s release by love has been cultivated, developed, and practiced, made a vehicle and a basis, kept up, consolidated, and properly implemented.
an8.1:4.1: Loving just one creature with a hateless heart
an8.1:4.4: a noble one creates abundant merit.
an8.1:5.1: The royal potentates conquered this land
an8.1:5.4: the sacrifices of the ‘casting of the yoke-pin’, <j>the ‘royal soma drinking’, and the ‘unbarred’.
an8.1:6.1: These are not worth a sixteenth part
an8.1:6.2: of the mind developed with love,
an8.1:6.3: as all the constellations of stars
an8.1:6.4: aren’t worth a sixteenth part of the moon’s light.
an8.1:7.1: Don’t kill or cause others to kill,
an8.1:7.2: don’t conquer or encourage others to conquer,
an8.1:7.3: with love for all sentient beings,
an8.1:7.4: you’ll have no enmity for anyone.”
